intro: Willoughbya flavescens, commonly known as the golden willow, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant features slender, willow-like stems and heart-shaped leaves that are typically green with a slight waxy coating. Willoughbya flavescens is often found in wetland areas and riparian zones, thriving in moist, sandy soils. It plays an important role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for various pollinators.
